PiSQzb-rlnHFdtENTNsqEQ.text: Once in a while I'd go out of my way to explore a new (for me) place because of the good reviews, and this month I decided to try this Vietnamese restaurant  in the quiet part of Scottsdale on Hayden and Roosevelt. The restaurant is cozy and nicely decorated with modern accents and service is friendly. I ordered bun nem thit huong (rice vermicelli noodles with grilled sausage and grilled beef), which turned out to be a good choice for a really hot summer day: cold rice noodles with tasty slices of grilled sausage and beef, a sprinkling of fresh cilantro and a side of the requisite nuac cham (rice vinegar dressing) - really good and well presented. I also had the sweet spicy wings, which had a good crunch and a bold but pleasing flavor. The strawberry boba smoothie was refreshing but would have been better if it were less sweet. In all, a satisfying meal at a good price in a pleasant, relaxing environment.

xii6KyKQvh1vwpK82arjIA.text: Good price, clean resistant , friendly staff , plenty of parking. These are all standard expectations so my reason for giving them 5 stars is because they never turn you away even if it you place an order 30minutes to closing time.

ZI0Q1UqQJEwrNgDXRo1YfQ.text: And I'm back! I'm always looking for the next best Pho! Today was another perfect cool gloomy day which only means one thing in my mind, and belly... pho! I work off of 44th st and Van Buren and sadly there are no Pho spots super close to me so I decided to venture off today. Per usual this spot was in a tucked away parking lot but my goodness was it amazing inside! Right away you're greeted by one of the friendliest staffs ever!! The place was so clean, fresh, and had an overall great atmosphere with white and green tones you felt almost tropical but serene. My waiter was super friendly, accommodating and tentative! The place was really busy during lunch which to me is a great sign. I of course ordered the Pho Tai, which is the traditional steak pho and this time I ordered the egg rolls. The rolls came out first and were super hot and crunchy. I honestly didn't like how they had them already pre cut, it was a little too messy since the crust was cut and kept falling everywhere.  The pho came out shortly after and the steak was so soft and tender, some of the best steak I've had in pho. However, here is the bummer point for me, the broth was very bland. It had a darker color to it so I'm curious to know what ingredients they used to make it darker but lacked flavor. I ended up adding double the sauces than I use too and it then tasted almost right!  Overall, I wish this place was closer to work, I really enjoyed it! They even had a big patio for seating outside which I have never seen!! The service was wonderful, food was fresh and all in all great place!

b9bvuCiQN-ziiM7w8S9uxA.text: Saigon Bowl is the perfect Vietnamese Restaurant around.  All of their food is fresh and delicious. The servers are friendly and really helped us out while ordering. This is what we chose:  Canh Ga Chien Nuoc Mam - Marinated fried chicken wings sauteed in house special sauce  Tom Cuon - Shrimp Spring Roll  Pho Ga - White Meat Chicken Noodle Soup  Bun Dac Biet - Grilled Shrimp, Imperial Rolls & Grilled Chicken  To sum it up, the chicken wings were my absolute favorite.. I've never had wings like this before and mmmm TASTY! The soup is average but the other winner was the Bun Dac Biet.. I will be back to order this dish by itself! Great job Saigon Bowl!  Don't forget to order a Cafe Sua before you leave :) There is nothing better than Vietnamese espresso with condensed milk.

photos.caption: Photo of Saigon Bowl - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pho Ga with Shrimp

AtuljNvVdXgcuLhHHishyw.text: My new favorite Vietnamese spot! The restaurant is simply decorated. Service was very attentive through dinner and the staff was super nice.  Everything we ate was GREAT! I had the hot jasmine tea and the SO had the iced tea. We ordered both the traditional spring rolls (with pork and shrimp) and the imperial rolls because we couldn't choose just one. They were both super tasty and VERY plentiful. I had the vermicelli bowl with pork sausage. Everything in that bowl was awesome and I love their fish sauce. The SO had the beef Bahn Mi, which of course I had a few bites of, and it was excellent as well. We left with full belly's and leftovers. To top it all off, the price is definitely right!  Highly recommend this place if you're looking for some quick, easy, and delicious Vietnamese food!

It's changed hands a couple years ago for the better the menu is as good but the new owners are making an effort's on the decor, straight out of the IKEA store it's fresh and young. 81Rwbv5I36ORZjn6o47ItA.text: Hard to find great pho outside of California but I have found my go to place. Their Nem Nuong rolls are amazing and their broth is something made by the hands of a mad genius. Everyone working there is attentive. The meats are really tender too!

ePI0L1mJUiiMNAeamAOKbg.text: Saigon Bowl is an unexpected gem. Hidden in a quiet strip mall, it serves wonderful Vietnamese food. The restaurant is typically busy for lunch but quieter at night. I've been the only customer in the restaurant on more than one occasion.   I have been coming here for years for the pho and bun. The fresh spring rolls made with rice paper are delicious! The owners are always on site keeping an eye on things and running the kitchen.  I recommend ordering bun - a cold vermicelli noodle salad. Add your choice of meat and maybe a cut-up egg roll, and enjoy! Another favorite is the classic pho, a savory beef soup, featuring thinly sliced beef, noodles, bean spouts, jalapenos, mint, basil, and more.

_FqQTbn9ApKDNxO41537fQ.text: Went here for quick lunch and got the shrimp spring rolls with the pork sandwich. I will be back next time for the Pho. Overly friendly staff and clean place. Food rolls were perfect and the sauce I could drink! The sandwich was priced way under for how it tastes! Like I said I will be back to rate the Pho.

JlJACDTtbz25cUGvkngAkw.text: I ordered takeaway and it was great. The noodle bowl had a good balance of ingredients, flavor, and crunchy, fresh vegetables. The meatball pho was flavorful, I think they use pretty good quality ingredients. Simple and fresh tasting.

zV_DUFnZeW82ln5i7KcqGw.text: I'm hard on pho joints.  Why? Because being from San Jose California I have had some great pho.  This place is just ok pho. It's not great it's not bad.  It's just ok pho. It will do in a pinch.  On the plus side, the service is great.

XOUHO5K2uz-rFQq2iCOmJg.text: To say I am a fan of Vietnamese food is an understatement.  I eat it about once a week.  I came here from recommendation from my nail lady saying it was the best in Scottsdale so I had to know for sure. The location kinda sucks - in an old shopping center that you wouldn't think to look twice at. Everything on the menu is very reasonably priced! The servers are soo friendly and they always remember me.  Atmosphere is nice and clean, pretty modern and they have a small patio for when the weather is nice.  Thai Tea with bobba: This is like crack its so freaking delicious!!  Buddha Delight - Was a little disappointed in the flavor and the variety of veggies - nothing special.  I was hoping for more.  Shrimp Spring Rolls - these are tasty and fresh.  I am not a huge fan of peanut dipping sauce but I know thats traditional with rolls now a days.  House special pork rolls were delicious - they have this crunch to them and saltiness are perfect!  Filet Mignon Pho - I was expecting this to be the traditional slices of sirloin but it was more like a ground beef?  I thought it was a little strange but the flavor of everything was great! The broth was amazing!  Chicken Pho - this has been my favorite so far! Great flavor - shredded chicken!  Vermicelli - My friend got the B4 combo - this was fantastic!!! This is a perfect dish.  Its light and fresh and flavorful!

YUFea6-QkDGTyUAa7HOUew.text: Give me a 5 star restaurant with a one $ price and I'm sold. Saigon Bowl is a perfect place to grab a delicious and authentic bite of vietnamese food. The prices are beyond fair, and the food- well, it speaks for itself. Normally, with price per dish averaging below $10 a plate, I keep my expectations for good service pretty low- However, the owners and staff at Saigon Bowl are the kindest and most genuine people! Their restaurant is clean, quiet, and all the ingredients are fresh. I know when I go to Saigon Bowl, I'm going to have a quality experience- in fact, you might begin to consider me a regular!

LsTa9dZOHUrkJN0kamN-9w.text: Visiting from Charlotte, North Carolina and I am a Pho snob. I have a favorite place back home and don't deviate. This place was EXCELLENT. Fresh veggies, tasty Pho, great service, cute / clean ambiance. I got the Pho shrimp and it was YUM. Also great prices. Would definitely recommend to the Pho eaters out there!

64OZCU0LHS1zk8ESfGD8iw.text: This is hands down the best pho in town! I moved here about a month ago and I have already been here 6 times! It's the best! Btw--- try the spring rolls, they are so fresh and yummy :-)

v8SIkHniQP3xZigInxAFVQ.text: Worst pho ever. I've been to many Vietnamese restaurants in my young 23 years and this is by far the worst pho I ever tasted. Usually I can finish whatever food I have (I'm not a picky eater), but this pho was so bad I had no choice but to leave, only having taken a few bites and tried to eat as much with seeming rude to the chef. HpeRyR4A-P9DbltVAROeqQ.text: Great job guys with the food and service, support them it is a family owned and operated business and it shows!!

jFDGej7zg0t8CuhdzhR2kA.text: The food and service were fantastic! We got shrimp pho, shrimp and imperial roll and beef bun, a ban mih sandwich, pork spring rolls, and a strawberry boba smoothie. We highly recommend this delicious little place!

sEgqLelbGluVxiWPtqbjQw.text: The staff were very helpful and friendly. I had never been before and they walked through the process of how to eat my Bun Dac Biet. The menu has a good variety of soups, rice/noodle bowls, sandwiches, and Chinese food. I highly recommend this restaurant and will come back to try some of the other menu items I was craving.

TPnSrXOacdvvIVoPq6-91Q.text: I've been to Saigon Bowl several times in the past and it was always a decent place for Vietnamese with the expected divey/mom & pop atmosphere. Saigon Bowl with its recent management/ownership changes retains its mom & pop charm, but with many key improvements.   Saigon Bowl now specializes in nem nuong cuon: a pork based spring roll and one of my favorite dishes. Their dipping sauce, is reminiscent of, but dare I say better than Brodard (Little Saigon restaurant famous for their nem nuong cuong). It's a definite must-have here.   Other dishes including their Pho Filet and fish sauce wings were also very good. Clean and fast service.

ce244HbTSCktTDc1WuTm7Q.text: I found this place on Yelp decided to come here for lunch with a friend. I got the beef lo mein wasn't super happy with it, she didn't like it either.   My friend got the orange chicken we both agreed it was amazing and  loved it.  I won't recommend the beef lo mein but I highly recommend trying this place. It's a great lunch place we got there at 12:12 and was in the car headed back to work at 12:45. You can totally make it there and back in a hour. The inside is super cute to and the boba is awesome! Highly recommend this place.

qi1ki98rohh8DVawNblojg.text: Super friendly staff and delicious food! I ordered steak pho and a strawberry boba milkshake - both were soooooo good. I highly recommend Saigon Bowl :)

LH39ky9pCflffHl0KiR6yQ.text: This Place Rocks! No doubt this place deserves a 5-Star rating. The family owned business are very committed to making a positive guest experience, everytime!! c8jNIVzDDRcQowngpzxsDg.text: I wanted to put a 2.5 but I couldn't do the half rating for some reason. The service was nice, the table was clean, and the food came out super fast. jAwj9-tZeHzTal50p_dwww.text: This little hole-in-the-wall joint has some of the best pho i've ever tried, I will 1000% be back. The meat is tender and the broth has so much flavor. The atmosphere is underwhelming and it was completely empty when we were there, but multiple people stopped by to pick up to go orders. 20wlgwxZd_7RIjkYF-D2sw.text: I eat here almost on a weekly basis. The food is just as great whether you are dining in or taking out. (But I recommend dining in because the staff is SO friendly!)  They have a fresh take on Vietnamese, which is what I love about Saigon Bowl. The staff is wonderful and truly cares about your authentic experience if you aren't familiar with the cuisine. I've never had a bad meal here. The food typically comes out super fast, which is great for days when you're in a rush. Plus, I love that they have a few boba choices (taro is my fave) and some of the best Thai iced tea I've had in the states. Love this place!

z9CqVsz41wsqWuWgEVyouQ.text: Great food, fast service.  Very polite.  Great place to order to go or dine on.  Love their beef and broccoli.

4_kb0L2HSIFH7zDqHP5llQ.text: I love coming here. Very clean and the food is good. Price is reasonable and service is great. Food comes out fast. I always try something new on the menus. They have a variety of dishes!

g9qZTDIWPElNr2yylvL3ew.text: Okay, so this review has been long overdue, like 2 years overdue. First thing you notice right away when you enter the restaurant is how clean the place is. Very welcoming. Definitely the best pho I have had in Arizona. I come here so often that the waiters remember pho tai, as soon as they come to take our order. I definitely recommend the pork sausage spring rolls, which I believe they actually make their own pork sausage in-house. The service is what makes this place a complete 5 stars for me. The brothers that work the front are always super nice and remember you. Never any long waits and the food is out fast, hot, and fresh.

oE7CdzQu7fg3GjeKuiySDw.text: This is not the best Vietnamese restaurant, however it is good enough to fill you up.  Located in an almost empty "shopping" plaza, Saigon Bowl serves the traditional pho soups and many rice combination plates. I went during lunch time and got the spicy chicken with lemongrass. It was actually spicy and good. The price of the plate was only 5.75 since it was during lunch time. Fountain drinks are only $.99. Service was okay, not the best. Overall, I had a good meal. Probably will be back to try their pho. If you are not careful, you will drive right by it.

c-NQfqR8bK8BY5xF0VmUyA.text: Sorry, but this place just doesn't stack up against other quality Vietnamese places around.  I ordered the 'Filet Mignon' pho to go. The packaging I must say was nice, with everything separated neatly and with care. Unfortunately, the flavors left a lot to be desired. I think that having the ingredients separated from the broth didn't lend itself well to the meal, since the flavors simply could not possibly permeate anything just by dumping it in.  The meat itself was pretty nasty and minuscule. It was soft and mushy, hardly what I'd call 'filet mignon'. I mean honestly, who would really think that could pass? And like I said, there was very little of it.  The broth was very bland with zero complexity. The noodles were chewy and the greens were still attached to the stem. Taking it off the stem might be a good idea for the future, just saying.   All in all, I was rather disappointed, sad to say. I wouldn't come back.

fvrzqQpa9X8wgX1eXQk73A.text: This was a fantastic find. The Pho was taste and was very well presented.  Our server said the restaurant was family owned and on hands on deck the night my adorable friend and I were there having dinner. He was amazing.  I would high recommend going to check this place out. Five thumbs up from me for sure.

rYMByoac1rdp7lVYbJbi3A.text: Stopped in for lunch. Very clean, spare space with about 15 tables, pleasant waitstaff. We ordered a Pho and Bun, very traditional Vietnamese fare. Both fresh and generous servings. Looking forward to coming back and exploring the menu.

YdfJIcoHXMCBlZ6stjzOjw.text: Visiting from out of town and going on Yelp trust, I gave the Vermicelli bowl at Saigon Bowl a try. It was just right. VF2N0_gKmkgWxuX2hKWdOw.text: My colleagues have raved about this place for months. Today, on my lunch break, I decided to give it a try. I placed an order to go for a grilled chicken banh mi, shrimp spring rolls and a Vietnamese iced coffee. After picking it up and bringing it back to work to eat... To my dismay, I discovered mid-bite in a spring roll that there was actual dirt in the lettuce that was in the spring roll. I was mortified. Might I add that it was also missing vermicelli noodles and cucumber. The grilled chicken banh-mi was not grilled, but sauteed.. however it did have good flavors to it, but since I am traumatized by the spring rolls, I will not be coming back for a second visit or ever.

bWlL2aRyafcwuHY3Oobu4Q.text: I eat here about once every 2 weeks. The food is always excellent, the restaurant is always spotlessly clean, and the staff is excellent.   If you're in the mood for some excellent Vietnamese food, you need to get in there.

mo8McL_jOUmHiT9IPonIMg.text: We ordered the Tom Tam Bot Chien (fried butterfly shrimp) and Bo Nuong Cuon (grilled steak spring rolls) for appetizers and an order of Bun Dac Biet (grilled shrimp, grilled beef and imperial (fried spring roll) over lettuce, veggies and noodles).   First, the customer service is AMAZING! Everyone is so friendly, attentive and helpful!   Second, the food was FANTASTIC!   I am a little weird about meat textures (if it isn't real AND tender, I'm pushing it to the side). I was COMPLETELY impressed and satisfied with the grilled shrimp and grilled steak. Everything was cooked to perfection, the sauces were tasty additions to the meal and the restaurant is nice, bright and clean.   100% chance of returning. YUMMY!

JXahsBQrPGaIMW7_FOzDDw.text: I've been going here for years, off and on.  Their pho is very good, but I've been getting their bahn mi sandwiches to go.  Their bahn mi sandwiches have gone downhill in quality!  I bought 2 tofu bahn mi sandwiches to go on 7/23/2018.  I took it home to enjoy relaxing at home.  First, the good:  the french bread was very good as well as the tofu and mayo.  What was very disappointing was the rotten smelling cilantro and it tasted bad too!  Then there was extremely thin freshly cut carrots.  It should have been but larger and with a mild pickled flavor, which it did not have.  It was also missing the white radish (daikon) also!  This is either a cost-cutting measure or someone did not know how to make a bahn mi!  I'm going to notify the staff there, since the waiters and I are friends--hate to see this establishment go under because they are not delivering what should be fresh and authentic.

kXEyFg4GsGQ3fWuEwA08Vw.text: This pho place is in a very unsuspecting strip mall. The service is always speedy and friendly! I would highly recommend it his spot for pho carry out! Ps their special spring rolls are great.

rh_DD-zhc2FsoBkbmYFiHA.text: So I NEVER write reviews, but this is worth the time! If you love pho, or are interested in trying it I have to say this place is amazing... ty1HPckAtvnRLvv3nlwMsg.text: Saigon Bowl is a cozy Vietnamese restaurant located about 3-4 miles from ASU's Tempe Campus. Due to recent management/ownership changes, the menu is now more focused on authentic Vietnamese cuisine including a selection of Banh Mi.  For lunch I sampled Com Ga Roti (Crispy Cornish Hen w/ rice), Canh Ga Chien Nuoc Mam, and Nem Nuong Cuon. All three items were very flavorful and tasted incredibly fresh--clearly made to order. Regardless of what entree you choose, I highly recommend ordering Nem Nuong Cuon (K1) as an appetizer. It's a rice paper roll with grilled pork sausage, lettuce, various Vietnamese herbs, and deep fried egg roll wrappers which adds a nice contrasting textural element. Nem Nuong Cuon is served with a special orange-hued dipping sauce. And although I have no idea what's in it, it's so good that I could eat it straight up.   Some added pluses include friendly, courteous service, and clean bathrooms. Employees offer you water while you wait for your take-out order. Updated decor, lighting, and dinnerware also improve the dining experience here.
